intro: Banisteriopsis parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved banisteriopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and are borne in clusters, while its fruits are small, indehiscent capsules. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
